definition: lit. viewing the sky with a basin on one's head; it is hard to get a clear view of the sky while carrying a platter on one's head/fig. it is hard to get on in one's career while encumbered by family obligations/one can't perform a major task while bothered by other duties
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
day/sky/heaven
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
jade garden of celestial ruler/paradise
to walk in a mincing gait (formal writing)
see 沾花惹草[zhan1 hua1 re3 cao3]
to search/to look for/to seek
to make endless exorbitant demands
surd (math.)
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
arbitrary/indiscriminate
cliff barring the way/fig. brick wall
to act according to whatever is the current outlook/pragmatic/unprincipled
mountain path
as if degenerating into smoke (idiom); ignorant and unable to see where things are heading
fear/dread/panic
